seller_research.name: Whatfix
seller_research.description: Whatfix is a digital adoption platform that provides organizations with a no-code editor to create in-app guidance on any application that looks 100% native.

pricing_models.description: Whatfix offers customized pricing based on the customer's needs. The pricing is composed of a flat fee, plus user license fees.
pricing_models.price: Varies based on the customer's needs

pricing_models.description: Digital Adoption platform: Standard plan with custom pricing
Digital Adoption platform: Premium plan with custom pricing

buyer_research.name: University of Illinois
buyer_research.description: A public research university in the Champaign–Urbana metropolitan area, Illinois, United States.
goals: To provide high-quality education to students
To conduct innovative research and create new knowledge
To engage with the community and contribute to the economy
use_cases: Providing a diverse range of academic programs
challenges: Meeting the needs of a diverse student body
Securing funding for research and programs
Staying competitive in a rapidly changing higher education landscape

competitors.name: WalkMe
differentiators: More focused on customer-facing use cases

competitors.name: Pendo
pros: Comprehensive voice of the customer features
differentiators: More focused on product analytics and customer feedback

competitors.name: Userpilot
cons: Less known than WalkMe and Whatfix

pains: Difficulty in providing seamless onboarding experience for students and faculty members
Challenge in meeting the needs of a diverse student body
Insufficient funding for research and programs
Difficulty in staying competitive in a rapidly changing higher education landscape
Need for modern and easy onboarding
Limited capability in providing personalized learning experiences
objections: Whatfix may not be able to integrate with our existing systems
The cost of implementing Whatfix may be too high
We are unsure if Whatfix can handle the scale of our university's operations
We are concerned about the complexity of setting up and using Whatfix
We do not see a clear ROI from investing in a digital adoption platform like Whatfix
We are not convinced that Whatfix can provide a better user experience for our students and faculty members
We have had negative experiences with similar platforms in the past

messages.content: Hi, thank you for taking the time to speak with me today. I'm excited to learn more about the University of Illinois's goals and challenges. Can you start by telling me a little bit about your role and what brings you here today?

Hi, thank you for having me. My name is John, and I'm the Director of IT at the University of Illinois. We're always looking for ways to improve our student and faculty experience, and we've been exploring digital adoption platforms to help us achieve that goal.

That's great to hear. Can you elaborate on what you mean by improving the student and faculty experience? What specific challenges are you facing that you're hoping a digital adoption platform can help with?

Well, we have a very diverse student body, and we struggle to provide a seamless onboarding experience for all of them. We also have a lot of different systems and applications that faculty members need to use, and it can be overwhelming for them. We're looking for a way to make it easier for everyone to get up to speed quickly.

I completely understand. It sounds like you're facing some common challenges in the higher education space. Can you tell me a little bit more about what you're hoping to achieve with a digital adoption platform? Are there any specific metrics or KPIs that you're trying to improve?

We're really focused on improving our student satisfaction and retention rates. We've also been struggling with limited funding for research and programs, so we need to make sure that any solution we implement is going to provide a strong ROI.

I understand. It sounds like you're looking for a solution that can help you improve the student experience while also being mindful of your budget constraints. Can you tell me a little bit more about your current onboarding process for students and faculty members? What do you currently use to support them?

Right now, we're using a combination of in-person training sessions and online resources to support our students and faculty members. However, we're finding that it's not very scalable, and it's not providing the level of support that we need. We're looking for a more modern and easy-to-use solution that can help us provide a better experience for everyone.

I see. It sounds like you're looking for a solution that can provide a more personalized and scalable approach to onboarding and support. Have you considered any other digital adoption platforms besides Whatfix? Are there any other solutions that you're evaluating right now?

Yes, we've been evaluating a few different options, including WalkMe and Pendo. We're still in the early stages of our evaluation, but we're looking for a solution that can provide a strong ROI and help us achieve our goals.

I understand. We've worked with a number of higher education institutions in the past, and we're confident that our solution can help you achieve your goals. Can you tell me a little bit more about your decision-making process for this project? Who else is involved, and what are the key factors that you'll be considering when making a decision?

Our decision-making process typically involves a committee of stakeholders from across the university, including IT, academic affairs, and student affairs. We'll be evaluating solutions based on their ability to meet our needs, their scalability, and their ROI.

I understand. We've had success with similar implementations in the past, and we're confident that our solution can meet your needs. What's the timeline looking like for this project? Are you looking to implement a solution within a specific timeframe?
We're hoping to implement a solution within the next 6-9 months. We have a budget allocated for this project, and we're looking to move forward as quickly as possible.

I understand. We'll make sure to provide you with a customized proposal that outlines how our solution can help you achieve your goals. Is there anything else that you'd like to discuss or any other questions that you have for me?
No, that's all for now. Thank you for your time today. We'll be in touch soon to discuss next steps.
Thank you, John. It was great speaking with you today. I'll make sure to follow up with a customized proposal and next steps. Have a great day!

insights: The University of Illinois is struggling to provide a seamless onboarding experience for students and faculty members.
They are facing challenges with limited funding for research and programs.
They are looking for a digital adoption platform that can provide a strong ROI and help them achieve their goals.
They are evaluating multiple solutions, including WalkMe and Pendo.
improvements: The seller could have asked more specific questions about the University's current onboarding process and pain points.
The seller could have provided more detailed information about Whatfix's pricing model and how it can meet the University's budget constraints.

features.name: In-app guidance
features.description: Provide step-by-step guidance to users within the application to help them navigate and complete tasks efficiently.

features.name: User experience
features.description: Enhance user experience by providing a seamless and intuitive interface that guides users through the application.

features.name: Step-by-step guidance
features.description: Break down complex tasks into simple, easy-to-follow steps, ensuring users can complete tasks independently.

features.name: Self-help user support
features.description: Offer users instant support and guidance, reducing the need for external assistance and enabling them to resolve issues quickly.

features.name: Onboarding
features.description: Streamline the onboarding process for students and faculty members, ensuring they can quickly get started with the application.

features.name: Training
features.description: Provide interactive and engaging training sessions that help users develop skills and knowledge efficiently.

features.name: Support
features.description: Deliver timely and effective support to users, ensuring they receive the help they need to overcome challenges and achieve their goals.

features.name: Customized pricing
features.description: Offer a pricing model that is tailored to the University's specific needs, ensuring a strong ROI and meeting budget constraints.

features.name: No-code editor
features.description: Empower the University's team to create in-app guidance without requiring extensive coding knowledge, reducing development time and costs.

features.name: Scalable solution
features.description: Provide a scalable solution that can adapt to the University's growing needs, ensuring a seamless experience for users.

messages.content: Hello everyone, and welcome to our demo call today. My name is [Sales Person's Name], and I'll be walking you through the features and benefits of Whatfix's digital adoption platform. I'd like to start by thanking you for taking the time to join us today. Can I start by asking, have you all had a chance to review the agenda we sent over prior to this call?
Yes, we've reviewed the agenda. We're excited to see how Whatfix can help us address our onboarding challenges for students and faculty members.

Great to hear that! Before we dive in, I just want to confirm that our objectives for this call are aligned. We're looking to demonstrate how Whatfix can help you streamline your onboarding process, improve student satisfaction and retention rates, and provide a strong ROI despite your limited funding for research and programs. Is that correct?
That's correct. We're also interested in seeing how your platform can help our faculty members who are overwhelmed with different systems and applications.

I completely understand. Our platform is designed to provide a seamless onboarding experience for users, regardless of their level of technical proficiency. Let me show you how our in-app guidance feature can help achieve that.

[Demonstrate the in-app guidance feature] As you can see, our platform provides step-by-step guidance to users within the application, helping them navigate and complete tasks efficiently. This feature is particularly useful for faculty members who may not be familiar with certain systems and applications.
That's really impressive. How does your platform handle customization? We have specific requirements for our onboarding process that need to be met.

We understand that every organization has unique requirements. That's why we offer a no-code editor that empowers your team to create in-app guidance without requiring extensive coding knowledge. This reduces development time and costs, and ensures that our platform is tailored to your specific needs.
We're concerned about scalability. How does your platform adapt to our growing needs?

Our platform is designed to be scalable, so it can adapt to your growing needs and ensure a seamless experience for users. We've had success with other clients in the education industry, such as XYZ University, who have seen a significant improvement in their onboarding process and user adoption rates.
That's reassuring. Can you tell us more about your pricing model? We have limited funding for research and programs, and we need to ensure a strong ROI.

We understand that budget constraints are a concern for you. We offer customized pricing that is tailored to your specific needs, ensuring a strong ROI and meeting your budget constraints. We can discuss the details of our pricing model further if you'd like.

Before I conclude the demo, I'd like to summarize the key benefits of Whatfix's digital adoption platform. Our platform provides a seamless onboarding experience, enhances user experience, and offers timely and effective support to users. We also provide a scalable solution that can adapt to your growing needs, and a customized pricing model that meets your budget constraints.
That's a great summary. We're interested in moving forward with the next steps. What's the typical implementation timeline for your platform?

Our implementation timeline typically ranges from 6-12 weeks, depending on the scope of the project and the level of customization required. We'll work closely with your team to ensure a smooth implementation process and provide training and support to ensure your success.

As a next step, I'd like to schedule a follow-up call to discuss the details of our proposal and answer any further questions you may have. We'll also provide you with a customized presentation and case study that outlines the benefits of our platform specifically for the University of Illinois. Does that sound okay to everyone?
Yes, that sounds great. Thank you for the demo today, and we look forward to reviewing the proposal and discussing further.
